intro: Pinalia latibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract pinalia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture. Pinalia latibracteata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
